revised_title: Experimental Determination of the Velocity of Transmission of Underwater Disturbances Caused by Explosions
tldr: This paper presents a series of experiments conducted to determine the velocity of underwater disturbances caused by explosions. The authors used a specialized chronograph to measure the time it took for the disturbances to travel a set distance in the Pacific Ocean. They found that the velocity of these disturbances was significantly faster than the velocity of sound in water.
